bioghist.p: Samuel Wetherill, Jr. was the son of Samuel Wetherill, Quaker preacher. Around 1789 Wetherill, Jr. began the first white-lead factory in the United States.

scopecontent.p: This is an account of the real estate owned by Samuel Wetherill, Jr., prepared by Samuel Price Wetherill. A number of the lots are in Philadelphia. The volume includes diagrams, descriptions, and appraisals of each lot with the name of its inheritor and a listing of the lots arranged by inheritor.
